comments.creator: winter@carto.net
comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-GB; rv:1.8.0.3) Gecko/20060426 Firefox/1.5.0.3
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-GB; rv:1.8.0.3) Gecko/20060426 Firefox/1.5.0.3

after a first uptdate to 1.5.0.3 and a later full reinstal off 1.5.0.3 in order to include the DOM manger (with following extensions: Flashblock 1.5.1, Talkback 1.5.0.1, Inspect This 0.2.3, DOM Inspector 1.8.0.3 and JSView 1.0.7) i run into the problem, that FF seems to cache wrong hrefs to existing files. so far i only had 2 problems, but anoying ones:

- i get a "File not found" for http://www.geotrace.net/srv/ico/ov.jpg . before full re-install i had the same problem with a previous copy of that file: http://www.geotrace.net/srv/ico/world_keymap.jpg  (no this one shows up but not the frist one.

- on a vBulletin 3.5.4 powerd page i was missing the central CSS. looking into the error console, i saw the CSS error showing binary data. calling http://www.gipfeltreffen.at/clientscript/vbulletin_css/style-00e2fca7-00001.css directly, i got the source code of a PNG back.

re-installing seemed to solve the problems, but again, the vBulletin  causes problems, when reediting a post (AJAX driven), icons are missing and the form cannot be submitted. the errors shown in the console seem to be based on either a wrongly linked JS-file, or a wrongly passed php session id.

clearing cache and private data doesn't help. other browsers (MSIE and Opera) do not have these problems on the same machine/ISP connection.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. surf intensively on several sites
2. at some impredictible time some href/src to images, CSS or JS files are wrong or missing although the files are there on the server and the server returns them well


Actual Results:  
file not found or wrongly linked files (within webpages or when called directly)

Expected Results:  
display the files called by URL.

see above
comments.author: winter@carto.net

comments.author: bfowler@ewitness.co.uk
comments.raw_text:
Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; U; PPC Mac OS X Mach-O; en-US; rv:1.9a1) Gecko/20060507 Minefield/3.0a1

You might want to check that this problem is reproducible with no extensions (preferably a fresh profile).

If your problem does indicate a bug in Firefox then it will be investigated, but defects in extensions are not accepted into this Bugzilla, and if you suspect 
that the problem lies with one of them then you should contact the author and/or look for the support offerings for that product (in the forums or on mozdev).
comments.creator: bfowler@ewitness.co.uk

comments.author: winter@carto.net
comments.raw_text:
hi,

indeed reinstall solved the problem and it may have been extension related. but as the bug occured with a delay of some days i will keep running FF without extensions some days and install the extensions one by one and look what happens. i will report here and on the concerned places when needed.
